custom_fields.key_topics: Frameworks for assessing ethical and social impacts of current & near-future artificial intelligence technologies.
custom_fields.goals: Explain many of the different ways that AI robotic technologies can impact people. Understand and consume analyses of technology from multiple disciplinary perspectives.
custom_fields.relevance:
Dietrich GenEd prior to 2021: Reflecting
Teaches students how to understand the impacts of technology on their lives.

long_desc: AI and robotic technologies are developing rapidly and are increasingly incorporated into decisions, practices, and activities that impact individual and social interests.  To ensure that these technologies advance meritorious goals without undermining important values or relationships, stakeholders must be able to understand the diverse ways in which new technologies can impact the lives of individuals and communities, the diverse dimensions on which such impacts can be evaluated and measured and where in the lifecycle of product development these various impacts might be anticipated and addressed.  Through a series of case studies of current or nearfuture AI and robotics technologies students in this course will explore frameworks for assessing, evaluating and regulating novel technologies with the goal of ensuring that they support and advance human interests and social values.
name: AI, Society, and Humanity
